sub_title: Working on the transition towards a fair, zero-emission society- "views my own"
summary:
Ambitious changemaker: manager, creator, do-er and relationship-builder.
Enjoy connecting people, developing networks, making talent and enthusiasm thrive in teams and inspire action. Excellent adaptive capacities: work effectively in new, challenging situations in new environments with multiple stakeholders with a strong sense for political and social situations. Outstanding capacity to switch between strategic thinking and planning and execution. Commercially, process and result oriented combined with problem-solving skills.
A keen interest in and drive for sustainability in the broadest sense (SDGs) Currently focusing on energy transition and supporting energy/ agri companies in East-Africa.

projects.title: Project Manager- Offsite catering validation for School Meals, Nairobi, Kenya- Enviu Foundation, the Netherlands
projects.description:
Validation of a commercial offsite catering business model for school meals in Kenya.
Managed the Kumanga School Meals project for Enviu Foundations Netherlands in Kenya, making sure 2200 meals including a fresh vegetable were served to pupils in Nairobi on a daily basis and gathering data for the validation. 
The project aimed to test the viability of a commercial off-site catering model for informal schools in Nairobi, making use of cosmetically unacceptable fruits and vegetables from the Kenyan export market.

The project later developed into FoodFlow: https://foodflow.enviu.org/

projects.title: Project Director- Independent Post-Procurement World Bank Audit, National Aids Commission, Malawi
projects.description: Project director the execution of the ex-post procurement review/audit of the National AIDS Commission in Malawi to assess whether value for money is achieved and make specific recommendations cases of non-compliance. The procurement audit covered all procurement carried out by and for selected implementing agencies i.e. NAC and Grant Recipient Organizations (GROs) including Line Ministries, Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs), CBOs, Faith Based Organizations (FBOs) and various Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) throughout Malawi.

projects.title: Supply Chain Audit, Sierra Leone
projects.description:
Quarterly supply chain audit of the complete  Free Health Care supply chain in Sierra Leone, from customs clearance to Central Medical Stores via District Medical Stores to Peripheral Health Units all the way up to implementing partners and local trading centers. This to establish the main points of leakage and put corrective actions in place. A total of four audits, one pilot audit, extensive initial audit covering 100% of 1200 Health facilities country wide, and two subsequent quarterly audits follow up on implemented actions.
The 100% audit involves a team of 14 international District Team Leaders leading 90 local Field officers during the audits of the Health Units.

Under the supervision of a UN Agency the tasks of the proposed institutional consultancy include: 
1. Evaluate the entire supply-chain system to identify the underlying causes of mismanagement and leakage. 
2. With guidance of the existing workflow process, review clearing and forwarding procedures undertaken by UN agency's contracted clearing and forwarding agencies in respect of UN agency's supplies to proceed through customs formalities.
3. Review transportation systems/procedures (loading, handling, security, offloading, etc) followed from sea port/ airport to warehouse and/or to implementing partners. Identify risks and recommend measures required to mitigate those risks.  
4. Undertake field visits to undertake stock takes at District Stores, Peripheral Health Units (PHUs), Community Health Units (CHUs), Community Health Centres (CHCs), District Education stores and UN agency's supported schools with the aim of establishing utilization of UN agency's  and Free Health Care supplies in line with agreed upon distribution plan.
5. In the 100% review, establish the total value of Free Health Care supplies not accounted for since August 2011 throughout the supply chain.

At this moment IPA is finalizing the 3rd review and preparing for the 4th review in August/ September 2012.

profile_positions.description: Darel Education is a non-profit initiative to create social support for the energy transition. We offer a fully catered Energy Transition Masterclass for a modest reimbursement of expenses, in which students get an overview of this complex challenge, the dilemmas and possible solutions.
profile_positions.title: Trainer Masterclasses Energy Transition

profile_positions.description:
DAREL balances purpose and profit to deliver energy transition today. 

We make impact, not only as consultants but also as investors and teachers. This is reflected in all our activities, allowing us to develop meaningful ideas, help shape agendas, involve younger generations and deliver results that surpass the expectations of our clients. 
www.Darel.nl

I am working on Energy Transition projects for the Port of Rotterdam, towards zero-emission shipping. Project leader of the project "Condor"- creating modular solutions with pay-per-use business models for H2 shipping with a large, international cross-value chain consortium.

I also enjoy supporting Darel Education in conducting Masterclasses Energy Transition at secondary schools, informing and inspiring the youth.
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Future Proof Shipping BV aims to accelerate the transition to a zero-emission maritime sector ahead of the industry targets to make the industry free of fossil-fuels and harmful emissions faster. We do this by building projects with all value chain parties to create our own fleet of zero-emission vessels and by supporting others to get clean vessels sailing.

Being responsible for business development I connected companies in the value chain that are willing to partner with us to start zero-emission shipping projects. Also created consortia for subsidy applications, such as the R&D project SH2IPDRIVE and RH2INE Kickstart IWT, which aims to develop hydrogen demand and infrastructure along the Rhine corridor.
profile_positions.title: Manager Business Development

profile_positions.description:
MS ORGANIC Vanilla Beans imports organically grown vanilla directly from small Ugandan family farms, selling in the Netherlands via Vanillapoint.nl and bol.com.

I support the company with the creation of business plans and trade channels.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Advisor

profile_positions.description:
The Green Elephant grows Elephant Grass in Uganda and performs research into the most efficient growing and biorefinery methods to create value added protein, minerals, organic fertiliser and fiber products. 
Applications can be plant based protein for human consumption, animal feed, agriculture, biodegradable packaging, construction applications and bio-fuels.

As the business development advisor I supported the development of the business plans, performed market research, partner development and funding applications.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Supply Chain Manager Europe at Avery Dennison -Industrial and Healthcare Materials (IHM)
Responsible for the full supply chain and plant logistics for the Business Units Performance Tapes and Vancive Medical. Areas included the S&OP process for the three BUs, production planning, raw material planning, goods reception, shipping, external warehousing, sample department, transportation, coordination of product transfers regionally and globally.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Manager Europe

profile_positions.description:
As the co-founder and managing director of the consulting firm Equate (U) ltd. performed all business development & tendering, managed projects with several private companies and development agencies in sub-Sahara Africa with consultant teams. Also worked as independent consultant for selected clients on projects for donors such as DFID, UNICEF, WFP, Belgium Technical Cooperation.

A selection of the projects executed can be found under the projects section.
profile_positions.title: Founder-Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Founder of the first professional international mobility company in Uganda offering relocation, immigration and other expat services and supports companies and NGOs to register and set-up business in-country. 
•	Established the business and standard processes for the operations, contracted 5 corporate clients within the first year.
•	Transferred operational management due to move to the Netherlands. Shareholder until 2022.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Shareholder

profile_positions.description:
Successfully directed the African office of International Procurement Agency (IPA) Group, a global service provider headquartered in the Netherlands providing services as procurement agent, in trade, procurement auditing and procurement/logistic consulting. Key responsibilities and achievements:
•	Developed and managed all aspects of the business in Africa, mainly procurement agency and consulting, leading to a growth from yearly revenue of USD 100,000 to USD 2 Million in two years.
•	Procured locally, regionally and internationally, mainly from Europe and Asia, and supplied to numerous countries such as South Sudan, Ethiopia, DRC, Burundi, Malawi, Zambia, Senegal, Sierra Leone by tendering, negotiating and coordinating with suppliers, freight forwarders and clients. Key clients were DFID, Malaria Consortium and CORDAID.
•	Ensured financial and legal compliance in Uganda and the countries IPA Africa worked in, such as Sierra Leone, Malawi, and South  Sudan.

A selection of the consulting projects managed can be found under the projects section.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director/ Shareholder IPA Africa

profile_positions.description:
Managed the African office of International Procurement Agency Group in Uganda. Improved financial management and compliance of the company, and the offices' procurement agency and tendering processes. Oversaw and executed procurement of a large variety of products for the development sector, largely medical items.

Started business development/ proposal writing for consulting services performed from the Ugandan office and created a network of consultants.
profile_positions.title: General Manager

profile_positions.description:
On a short term contract managed the logistics of UNICEF, the UN Agency promoting the rights and wellbeing of children. Key responsibilities and achievements:
•	Daily management of warehouses, Logistic Service Providers and order processes in Uganda. Improved the data accuracy of the warehousing system.
•	Managed the tendering process of Logistic Service Providers for Uganda and South Sudan.
•	Coordinated processes and communication between procurement, supply chain, and programme departments and improved internal processes.
•	Supervised consultants executing bednet distributions, and represented UNICEF in the meetings with Uganda Ministry of Health and other agencies in the Global Fund Round 7 mosquito net campaign for distribution of 17 million mosquito nets in 31 districts of Uganda.
profile_positions.title: Logistics Specialist- a.i.

company.name: Nurture the Child- Student Sponsorship Foundation

volunteer_experiences.description:
www.nurturethechild.org

Marjon's foundation is sponsoring children in her neighborhood "Naguru" in Kampala in education from nursery to secondary school . It started with providing scholastic materials, and developed into payment of student school fees and teacher salaries in 2011 and 2012, with funds received from friends and family in Europe. 
Mid- 2012 the foundation "Nurture the Child" was founded to formalize the project in the Netherlands. We sponsored 145 children in 2013 and the first pupils have graduated from secondary school in 2019. 
In 2020 we are sponsoring 70 pupils in primary and secondary schools in Kampala.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Aivg7vADfok&list=PLtuSMgWraQtRfIqP8G2rCIaXl8uwNV_u_&index=26
